instantiatesCanonical: Decision to Screen

status: Draft

intent: Proposal

subject: Jane Doe

action

id

SDMContinueScreeningLifeExp

title: Shared decision making to continue screening based on life expectancy

description: Decision to continue screening mammography in cases of limited life expectancy should be based on shared decision-making. ACS advises that women should continue screening mammography as long as their overall health is good and they have a life expectancy of 10 years or more. Life expectancy is generally defined as having greater than a 50% probability of surviving 10 years. A validated tool such as www.eprognosis.com can help guide decision making.

code: Shared decision making to continue screening

Documentations

-TypeLabelDisplayCitationUrl
*CitationACSBreast Cancer Screening for Women at Average Risk: 2015 Guideline Update From the American Cancer Society

Saslow D, Boetes C, Burke W, Harms S, Leach MO, Lehman CD, Morris E, Pisano E, Schnall M, Sener S, Smith RA, Warner E, Yaffe M, Andrews KS, Russell CA; American Cancer Society Breast Cancer Advisory Group. American Cancer Society guidelines for breast screening with MRI as an adjunct to mammography. CA Cancer J Clin. 2007 Mar-Apr;57(2):75-89.

https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2463262

resource: Bundle: type = collection

action

id

SDMDelayScreeningLactating

title: Shared decision making to delay screening based on lactation status

description: There is no contraindication to screening mammography during lactation, however sensitivity and specificity are decreased. For average risk patients, consider a short delay in routine breast imaging until after lactation, particularly if they are not planning prolonged breastfeeding.

code: Shared decision making to consider delay in screening

resource: Bundle: type = collection

action

id

ACSMammoAvgRiskAgeUnder45

Recommendation Flag Extension: Overdue

title: Annual screening mammogram starting age 40

description: Women between 40 and 44 have the option to start screening with a mammogram every year.

code: MG Breast Screening

action.title: Shared decision making to continue screening based on life expectancy
action.description:
Decision to continue screening mammography in cases of limited life expectancy should be based on shared decision-making.

ACS advises that women should continue screening mammography as long as their overall health is good and they have a life expectancy of 10 years or more.

Life expectancy is generally defined as having greater than a 50% probability of surviving 10 years. A validated tool such as www.eprognosis.com can help guide decision making.

coding.display: Shared decision making to continue screening

American Cancer Society guidelines for breast screening with MRI as an adjunct to mammography. CA Cancer J Clin. 2007 Mar-Apr;57(2):75-89.

action.title: Shared decision making to delay screening based on lactation status
action.description: There is no contraindication to screening mammography during lactation, however sensitivity and specificity are decreased. For average risk patients, consider a short delay in routine breast imaging until after lactation, particularly if they are not planning prolonged breastfeeding.
